Early Access Review
								This is an inspirational story about a cyclops named Chlorophyllius.One day in the pit, a band of gladiators were in a battle against the unfair enemies. At round 1, 3 of them died. The 2 remaining, Benedict and Chlorophyllius, were placed against almost a dozen opponents. They killed Benedict, and the only one left standing was Chlorophyllius. He then went to avenge his companion, charging into the crowd.Despite the fact that he was extremely outnumbered, Chlorophyllius fought back with all his might and defeated the horde. That's when round 3 started. He knew he had to do this completely alone, and stepped forward. Chlorophyllius fought with all his might, blow after blow, kill after kill.After the dust cleared, there was only 1 gladiator standing.Chlorophyllius.He had prevailed. He didn't know how it happened, but still. He did it.I, however, know how he won.He never gave up.Be like Chlorophyllius and go the extra mile for the greater good.

								I wasn't sure what to expect, I'm a huge fan of Castle Crashers & Battleblock Theater, but I'm not a fan of turn based games. This however, is a different story, I love this game, even in early access, it feels EXTRMELEY polished and is a joy to play, both solo and with a friend.There's tons of hilarious items to use, tons of Behemoth humor that I love, and tons of detail to the maps/arenas. As for the gameplay, it feels arcade-y, without losing a smidge of any strategic elements, which is very hard to do. Then there's the 'hub' where they have an Arena, Online, Item Shop, Character/Group Customization, which of course, is dislayed in a humerous style (I wont spoil). The map roaming is perfect for this game, lots of content, lots of things to fight, plenty of quests and side quests to do, none of which are filler. Props to The Behemoth for creating another awesome, masterfully crafted game that I need to recommend!

Posted: January 16
Early Access Review
								Like all Behemoth's games, Pit People is very polished and it brings something interesting (and funny) to the table. If you have played Castle Crashers or BattleBlock Theater, there are a lot of familiar things you will encounter - art style, humor and the narrator to mention a few.Pit People does not necessarily innovate something new. Rather, it combines mechanics from many popular games and ends up creating quite an interesting result. You will feel the presence of XCOM, Fire Emblem, Skulls of the Shogun or damn, even Pokemon. Most of the time games mixing that many ideas would end up being bad. This is not the case with Pit People - it feels truly original.The combat is plain simple but vast collection of different unit types and items make this game quite strategical. There are endless amount of combos to test and new interesting characters to find.Lastly, I wouldn't be too worried about the Early Access tag on this game. Sure, most of the main story is missing (you can only complete about 5% of it) but there is still a lot to do in this version. There are multiple plot driven side quests to do, units to catch and other players to crush (in online mode). Highly recommend.

Posted: January 15
Early Access Review
								Those maniacs at The Behemoth have done it again! Using their signature style of whimsically stupid Newgrounds-like animation, they've created an enthralling narrative about a blueberry farmer living in the post-apocalypse created by the aftermath of BattleBlock Theater and the four-armed sociopathic bear deity that wants nothing more than to royally screw with him and his friends!It's also worth mentioning that this is the greatest turn-based strategy game I've ever played! Never before have I been so taken aback by commiting bucket-head genocide in grid-based fashion as I have with this game!It's more-than-likely also worth mentioning that this is the weirdest turn-based strategy game I've ever played! Never before have I been so taken aback by watching a cupcake feed itself to death to heal a team of bandits that it doesn't even like!

Posted: January 16
Early Access Review
The Behemoth Keeps ImpressingThe Early Access title scared me a bit, I've been let down with other Early Access titles.However, The Behemoth seem able to even get Early Access down right. The game has good content, classic to the dev's unique personality and humor, and the game is a blast to play. I admit I wish there was more to the main story at present, but I also have faith in these developers that more quality content is to be expected.For now, the strategy element is engaging while maintaining a casual, zany atmosphere. The game is hilarious and fun to play, obviously very similar to Castle Crashers and the previous titles as far as animation and artistic design goes. The game plays well, keeping up the pace while still paying respects to turn based strategy. The customization options for fighters are plenty entertaining, and playing co-op and versus with friends is fantastic.I'm going to keep playing this game more than enough time to warrant fifteen bucks.Highly recommended.

Posted: January 16
Early Access Review
								I'm excited to see the limited amount of content grow. Behemoth has always done a great job putting together unique games with their own sense of humor and style. As of early access, they still deliever with their signature style. The art of Dan Paladin is ever present. Simple, humorous, delightful. There were a few times the art was pixelated but I'm sure that'll be fixed. Some of it (art, map, UI) feels a bit overly busy. As far as content, UI, and fighting system, alot needs to be worked on. The fighting system is simple but shallow and there's two story missions along with a few side quests. I imagine over the next year (in which Behemoth works towards release) mechanics and story will be built upon. So if you're buying it now, know you're only going to get a few hours of enjoyment at first. But if you believe the track record of the Behemoth team and their wonderfully unique spirit, it's worth to get the game now and support the team!

Posted: February 7
Early Access Review
								You know I wasn't going to write a review for this game untill it cam out of Early Access but god damn is this game fun! I've just finished the main story and to be honest I can't wait for the future parts of story mode to come out. The artstyle is great with lots of detail put into every part of the map (the bouncing houses are my favourites). The battle system works really well too. At first I thought it was going to be chaotc nd confusing like a turn based castle crashers but this game actually made me put a lot of stagety into each turn. You see one of my party members is a unicorn which in this game is a motar tower. Each turn I have to move into a place where it hits the enemy but also so it doesn't it my other team members. Oh and the healing, oh the healing. The healing in this game workss really well. Basically your healers in this game are some strangely sexy cupcakes that take damage when they heal you since it is feeding its body to you. However my cupcake has never died because like I said this game brought out the strategist in me so my cupcake was always in the safest place. Once again the classic Behemouth humour is in this game which is always welcome and Stamper returns to voice the best video game villain of 2017 so far. I highly recommend this game to everyone especially fans of fire emblem and other turn based strategy games. Just like teeny tiny iced creams, I know you'll love it. ;)

								Recently bought this game after seeing a few Youtubers playing, I was not dissapointed. Although, it is currently in early access if you do the side stuff there is enough content to justify buying it and it's reduced for early access buyers. I usually don't play many turn based stratergy games, but this one is has quite a quick pace and good mechanics. I really appreciate the style, jokes and genral qwerkyness of the game. The game is quite easy to pick up and has good local multiplayer. My main issues are that when different chracters have buffs you can't find out what they are. For example in the equip menu buffs have icons, but they aren't very self explanatory. If when you put your highligted them you'd get a little box of text which told you what the buff did that would be good. Also, with the Lady Legless quest I didn't have Yosef on my team and entered the quest, this then wouldn't allow me to finish the battle as she wouldn't die. When I had Yosef on my team it worked due to story reasons, prehaps if the quest didn't start without Yosef this could be fixed. The addition of ranked online battles in the pit would also be appreciated, however I'm mostly nit picking now. I really like this game and strongly recomend it.

Posted: January 26
Early Access Review
								This is a review for an Early Access Game. Opinions herein are subject to change upon advancements in the games development. This review will be updated as each new patch rolls out for the game.Pit People.. Pit People.. This game is absolutely bonkers, and I adore it so for such. Whilst the storyline is nowhere near finished (Early Access) there are a plethora of missions and so on to embark on, as well as countless enemies to "Recruit" (Kidnap) into your party. My current party is a Hairball which regenerates health per turn, and hits for massive damage, a cupcake which heals my party members by slowly killing itself, your typical knightly party member but with an Elvis haircut, a Unicorn that fires exploding rainbow artillery horns, and a recruitment person. Party diversity is key.Pros:- Fantastic Soundtrack, which I've listened to outside of the game for hours.- Easy to understand movement system, as well as targetting.- Diverse enemies available to be recruited. From Mushrooms that fart on you and flip you off, to frogs that explode.- Hilarious questlines, which take an hour or so to complete if focused on completing the entire quest line.- Difficulty scaling is quite fair, with the ability to set the difficulty to "Insane" at any point.- Easily organized co-op, as well as split screen co-op using Mouse+KB and a controller.- Humorous "language" spoken by the characters within the game.- Exploration where you can ignore any/all enemies if you like.Cons:- Minor Framerate issues whilst exploring (Though, once more as stated above, it is an Early Access title, and this is subject to change).- Rather boring equipment system, where each weapon is generally cosmetic depending on their grouping.- Lack of Micromanagement aside from moving characters to an area, without the ability to designate specific targets, though this is most likely intentional.Overall: I'd rate the game an 8, however relatively close to being a 9. It lacks polish, as it is an Early Access game, however I am extremely excited to see what the future holds in regards to this game.

Posted: January 15
Early Access Review
whoops, BUTTERFINGERSBehemoth's stab at a turn-based strategy game is certainly worth a shot, but not without a handful of issues that aren't what you'd expect in EA. So far in my playthrough, the game itself is bug-free and performs without any hitches, much to Behemoth's credit as a respectable developer. However, the controls in menus are just a step above abysmal, clearly being designed to be navigated with a controller. Selections stick and feel imprecise, and at times I feel a need to be extra cautious should I accidentally sell or buy something I don't intend to. The gameplay handles well enough, but when panning the camera via WASD or arrow key the scroll speed is sluggish, and input icons switch to Xbox inputs for whatever reason.Gameplay itself is deceptively deep, with an easy learning curve and intuitive mechanics leading into a variety of new weapon variants, effects and troop selections once you get a handle on the basics. However, issues again arise in the menus, with visual cues for stats and weapon status effect icons being at best a vague suggestion on how they work. I shouldn't have to play 20 questions worth of guesswork to figure out what exactly something does or how it's implemented, and a lack of a clear-cut glossary or tooltips only serve to frustrate when introduced to what up to that point was a very intuitive and enjoyable experience. Experimenting with different combinations is fun, but not as fun as it could be when I'm left wondering things such as "can I do anything to unfreeze friendly units, or do I have to wait out the effect?"The story and atmosphere is enjoyable, with the antagonistic narrator that I personally find much more entertaining than Battleblock Theatre, and an experience more in line with what we've seen in the past with Castle Crashers and Alien Hominid. Behemoth's simple, charming signature style works to the game's benefit, with the game boasting a variety of weapons, enemies and recruitable troops that I've only begun to scratch the surface of.I have yet to touch the MP, but I'll probably write about it later on. Who knows.Overall a very solid early access title, but not without some glaring issues that I hope to see resolved in the future.spacebear blood got in my eye christ help me / 10

Posted: February 18
Early Access Review
 Pit People is another great turn-based charming strategy game on Steam. I didn't finish the main story line yet because I don't usually do that during Early Access phase or I wouldn't play the main story after its full release. But despite that, I've finished necessary main quests to enjoy the game's full aspect and some few sub-quests.STORY So having played only intro missions, so far the story is funny yet very random! So far, I have no desire to finish the main story during early access phase, I cannot say much about it at this moment. Sub-quests are also great as situations often go hilariously unexpected. So far people are saying main story is quite short so I hope main story becomes longer than it is and maybe more sub-quests!GAMEPLAY There are huge customization options in Pit People. Every units can fit into different roles depending on which weapons, shields and helmet you desire to put them on. As you explore the overworld, there are different unit types you can "recruit" by capturing them like Pokemon. Many of these units carry different avatars of item types, so capturing them becomes addictive. Although there are currently 19 types of units in this game, I wish for more types of units to capture.Having to level them up during progression makes your units personally attached. Unlike XCOM, there is no permadeath so it's okay for them to die. Permadeath would be another good addition if there will be a sandbox mode. As turn-based strategy game, the positioning is extremely important. Unlike other games, you only command your units to move in specific positions while they will do anything on their own to their possible attackable enemies. But don't worry, they will do their best to win the battle. The overworld is huge! There are 125 POIs you can explore and features many different biomes to sink your foot in. While it's very fun to explore these places, I wish for randomized sandbox mode, which would increase higher replayability in exploring, randomized quests.Overworld is procedurally randomized, so hopefully there will be more than 125 POIs on full release as I am already reaching near 100% Co-op campaign and pvp are great options to enjoy with friends and strangers over Internet. These make perfect reason why capturing units outside of the city is more enjoyable. Seriously, Pit People needs more interesting unit types to "recruit"! There are many different things to try like Insane mode, the pit with AI vs Players and etc which increases replayability.AESTHETICSArt style is very consistent across Behemoth games. Having played their older games back in Newgrounds, they still retains that funny and funky art style. Avatars for each units are usually random and hilarious, having 1357 of them are excellent! Only thing I would point out is that some vector graphics are pixelated when zoomed in, maybe this should be eradicated when leaving Early Access. Excellent sound design, love the vicious narrator, overall very good!OVERALLEven though this is early access title, it's well polished, very fun, highly replayable. Pokemon aspect truly shines as well as team-building aspect of this game. The game is very well balanced and it is the wonderful game to collect in your collection!

								Pit People is a one of those 'Easy to play, hard to master' types. It's fast to finish your turn just a few clicks, that's right, there's no special type of attacks your charcters can use. The Cyclops who can gaint weapeons, clubs and send people flying! There is even cupcakes, wraths and other scary and funny allys(or foes)I'll give this game a 7.5. Posted: February 9
Early Access Review
								If you want a chess like strategy game that has a natural feeling of progression along with weight for losing and joy for getting that lucky hit, then this game is for you. It has a booming soundtrack, with colorful graphics and they both play along side each other very well, if the style is for you. Weapons and armor are both neat and enjoyable to collect from random enemies and quests. Quests are also fun, and out in the world map the side quests that exist are repeatable after a move for extra gold and loot.Probably, the best part about this game, aside from the developers just being neat people from newgrounds, is the lack of pressure from doing "wrong stuff". Want to play the game, sure it's single player, don't have internet, don't worry. Want to fight a random troll momma and lose possibly, don't worry you just get sent back to town if you die with full hp so you can try again. Don't want to login to get "daily rewards" don't have to, they don't exist.This game reminds me of a game that came out back in the N64 or PS1-2 era. You want to play the game, sure, play it, no pressure or incentives other than a good game. Want to play with your friends, sure go for it. It's a game that wants to be played, it's not a "triple A" game that wants to show you how to use a god dam store to purchase microtransactions.A good game like this only comes around every blue moon when you have developers who want to make a game that is legit fun.+1 Devs.

Posted: January 18
Early Access Review
Fast-paced Turn-based Fun Place!What's this? The Behemoth, the creators of my favorite beat-em-up and one of my favorite platformers, made a turn-based game? Sign me up!I'm a fan of turn-based games with RPG elements: the Fallout games by Interplay, Wasteland, Fire Emblem, the works. Seeing this game annouced, I was a little skeptical. Specifically, about the co-op features. Many turn-based games with co-op have each player move individually. But I'll be beaten down with a rubber hose filled with frozen custard if The Behemoth didn't make it work.I can easily compare the gameplay to Fire Emblem, but boiled down to what's important. No faffing about with the weapon triangle for Pit People! Bigger weapons do more damage but weigh more. Archers aren't effective at close range. Maces work better on armored foes. Ultimately, the secret to success is how you position your soldiers on the field. Different squads can mesh together in different ways, allowing for interesting stratigies that work for you.The humor is nothing new if you've played Behemoth's previous, with the glorious glorious voice of Stamper, the narrator in Battleblock Theatre, making a return as the narrator. This time around he's made out to be super sarcastic and passive-aggressive towards the protagonists. It's truly a joy to behold the dialouge. But as they say, the devil's in the details. Pit People has a lot of tiny details that make it much more enjoyable. For example, each unit type has a special entry corralating to them. And the entries are just an absolute joy.This game is a-okay in my book!

Posted: January 21
Early Access Review
								Let met start by saying I reccomend this game. The laughs itself is worth the $15. The behemoth always makes pretty good games, and I've known about several of the people involved in this game back in their Newgrounds days over a decade ago. But, I do believe this game has some issues - not counting the incomplete story campaign, which is mentioned in-game by the developers as a work in progress. At the time of writing this, it will only last you about an hour if you try to complete it quickly. But the game also generates random encounters with rewards and ratcheting difficulty, as well as co-op and multiplayer vs.The good:- The game is funny. Really funny.- The strategy is easy to pick up and accessible. - Play with a friend!- Turn-based strategy without the premadeath and nessescary save-scumming that *cough* X-Com still seems to have a hard time getting rid of.- A high degree of customization and collectibles seems to provide a lot of replay value.- A giant world with tons of sidequests and rewards.The bad:- This game has a wierd habit of making the world full of color and life, but making the characters washed out and a little bland. For a capture-the-pokemon style of collection and recruitment, it's weird that most of the combatants are stark white humans in off-white clothes.- The strategy is flat, without elevation, without a variety of terrain bonuses or a huge variety in abilities or defences. Most fights turn into bottlenecking and musical hexes.- Health bars are so huge that often the fights turn into attrition slugfests.

Posted: January 21
Early Access Review
								READ THIS IN YOUR WILL STAMPER VOICEI remember playing castle crasher back in 2010 and absolutely loving each and every bit of it, even going as far as to complete the game many times using the Dance Dance Revolution dance pad or Guitar Hero 2 controllers for hours on end,... Then I found out about alien hominid, and I absolutely loved that too (even though it was hard as all hell). When Battle Block theatre was announced I couldn't wait (but I had some how managed). Bought it the day it game out and enjoyed the living♥♥♥♥♥♥out of that game, the reason I didn't buy it on steam was that I managed to unlock nearly head for the prisoner. The second I found out about game number four (now Pit People) I♥♥♥♥♥♥bricks. I had just played through games like XCOM and Fire emblem (WaifuWars:Awakening) and really started to like the turn based strategy genre so I felt like fate had delivered the dream game. Little did I know that this dream game would also be early access. Mow lets get into the pros and cons (so far).PROS+The signiture Behemoth artstyle, the very reason I love the brush tool in Adobe Flash (By the time I typed Flash it   crashed)+Wonderful soundtrack I walready wish I could buy.+Lots of customization.+Instead of moving units one by one they all move at once.+A unique system of instead targetting an any, a charater will instead attack one enemy withen thier range prioritizing  melee attacks over ranged attacks.+A simple armor system.+The randomly generated enemies and names (as far as I know though the character types and positions do not change   for scenarios which is awesome)+The "class/races" as far as I can tell play pretty differently and uniquely. I couldn't imainge what game would have a   cupcake that mutilates itself to heal others, though its probably hidden somewhere in some DnD story.+The humor. I'm always one for a good fart joke, but when voiced by Will Stamper, I love a good fart joke,+Will stamper is the one voice that isn't in the parody of simish that the characters speak in. I love it.CONS-No name customization, though I do like the random names I wanna name a party after a few friends and I then place   bets on who dies in what order in the pit.-The game explains how to play it, but not how the character building works which you kinda just learn on your own.-Catchin- errr "recruiting" a unit always seems to give me two stars instead of three after each battle, but it makes sense   considering Will Stamper praises you for as murdering as many people in a turn as you can.-Never seem to get a toon gold, but not too much of a con unless you really want to buy a 7K gold unit.-Not enough content... yet.For dedicated Behemoth fans you should buy this after reading this, it has a fairly short download time too so you won't die from getting hyped. For people who have played a Behemoth game I would wait a week or so then check on the updates.For people who are interested in this you should wait a month, then check on the updates.If Dan Palidan and Tom Fulp are reading this, thank you for work and time. I really hope you enjoy your work as much as I do. I really hope you guys flesh this game out. You already have 1,300+ ITEMS, each one unique and quirky! I don't know how you manage to do it but you guys really buckle some pants when it comes down to making video games. Keep at it!

Posted: February 15
Early Access Review
								Without a doubt, this is one of the best RPGs I've played in a long while – the art and animation is hilarious and distinctive, the combat is simple but incredibly addictive, the writing is absolutely brilliant, and the music is just really damn funky. To top it all off, it's got a hilarious narrator in the form of StamperTV as a giant space bear, who I think has done some great voice-over in other Behemoth games. There are just so many little details crammed in, like the rainbow unicorn creatures leaving a poo trail as they drag their arses along the ground, to the cord of the giant space phone that you use for multiplayer co-op trailing off into space on the world map, to the fact that the giant space bear actually picks up the whole hub city and moves it to a completely different world map at random now and then just for ♥♥♥♥♥ and giggles. Yes, none of that will make sense until you play it. Please do.Worth noting is the fact that, as an early-access game, the actual main story is barely there, but Behemoth made up for this by packing in a goldmine of delightfully random side-quests that should keep you going for around 10-20 hours, more if you go all-out on finding all the hidden secrets and recruiting all the potential characters.All in all, if they can make me adore an early-access game this much, then I await the finished product with fear and awe.

When I had Yosef on my team it worked due to story reasons, prehaps if the quest didn't start without Yosef this could be fixed. Posted: January 21
Early Access Review
								Pit people is a must buy for people who are fans of Behemoth's games. But if your still concerned, the game is in early access, which is a suprise once you get into the game beause I didn't find any bugs. But the game can be beat in about an hr and 30 mins but they are adding more story in later patches. There are about 20 differnt types of enemies, hopefully they will add more. But the story we do have now, is funny and interesting. I dont like to saw this but the game is really....really slow. when you play the game you will say im wrong but im talking about the fights. which can take a long time because a lot of the enemies run away from you and make your job harder. I like how you can catch enemies and put them on your team. If i had to pick what game it is most like I would say Xcom and a bit of pokemon and I havent played a game where you you can go out in the world and chose who you fight. the only thing I can think of is South Park:The stick of Truth canada area of the game with the bears and snakes etc. so finally I would give this game at the moment 7.5/10 I will come back and change this review when I see big changes to anything I have wrote, so as i said before if your a fan you shoud buy it. But if your bit unsure I would still get. Because when the game is down you will not regret it. This Behemoth not a random indie person. They will finsh it, and it will be great.

Posted: February 16
Early Access Review
								This game is fantastic. It's amazing, totally great. The first thing you'll witness as you start the game is the amazing music it caress your moist ears with, after that you'll be thrown into a world built on the core of top notch humour. You battle humans and creatures in a tactical system. Collect gear and weapons, and capture said creatures to fight for you in later battles. If you have some money to spare, buy the game. It will keep you occupied for hours. The developers actually listen to the fanbase, and on top of all of this: There's an actual fun PvP and CO-OP system. What can you say? Well, The Behemoth delivered a fantastic CO-OP, PvP, online game once again!

Posted: January 29
Early Access Review
								The Best game that is currently early access. Keep in mind that this is early access.9.5/10Pro:+ Will Stamper a.k.a Quibs from Battleblock theater is in it as the narrator.+ Funny Gameplay during the fights+ Lots of Enemy/ Ally types+ Great turn based system+ "The Pit" is a fun way to test out team compositions, it is basically an arena to fight in.+ Simple level system+ Funny way to recruit new allies, you throw a net on the lone enemy and you take him back to townCons:- Not much story, but that is because this is in ** early access. **- only a few weapons that look desirable - not that many healer types- limited inventory space in the wagon which is how you travel around the world map, the space is about 10, fills up fast- only customization options to characters are weapon, shield, and head. (We ned more gear customization, like shirts to get rid of that plain baige t-shirt)Both:+/- promotes grinding in "the pit" instead of the world due to small inventory space
